name: Ebola, Ebola fever, Ebola hemorrhagic fever
description: A severe and often fatal disease in humans and nonhumans primates (monkeys and chimpanzees) caused by the Ebola virus
symptoms: Characterized by high fever and severe internal bleeding
transmission: Can be spread from person to person

name: Cholera, epidemic cholera, Asiatic cholera, indian cholera
description: Any of several acute infectious diseases of humans and domestic animals, caused by the Vibrio cholerate bacterium through ingestion of contaminated water or food
symptoms: Usually marked by severe gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea, abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting, and dehydration
transmission: Contaminated water or food

name: Polio,infantile paralysis, poliomyelitis
description: Acute infection by the poliovirus, especially of the motor neurons in the spinal cord and brainstem, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis and sometimes deformity
symptoms: marked by the inflammation of nerve cells of the brain stem and spinal cord
transmission: Not known

name: Tuberculosis,TB
description: An infectious disease of humans and animals caused by a species of mycobacterium mainly infecting the lungs where it causes tubercles
symptoms: Characterized by the expectoration of mucus and sputum, fever, weight loss and chest pain, Manifested in fever and small lesions (usually in the lungs but in various other parts of the body in acute, short, quick stages)
transmission: Transmitted through inhalation or ingestion of bacteria (tubercle bacilli)

name: Malaria
description: An effective disease caused by sporozoan parasites that are transmitted through the bite of an infected Anopheles mosquito; A disease spread by mosquito, in which a protozoan
symptoms: Marked by paroxysms of chills and fever. An accute fever, intermittent fever, attended by alternate cold and hot fits
transmission: Transmitted through the bite of an infected Anopheles mosquito

name: Dengue
description: Severe cases develop into dengue hemorrhagic fever, which involves high fever, hemorrhaging, and sometimes circulatory failure
symptoms: Characterized by high fever, severe headaches, muscle and joint pains, and rash
transmission: It is spread through the bite of the Aedes aegypti mosquito

name: Pneumonia
description: Pneumonia has many possible causes, but it is usually an infection of the streptococcus or mycoplasma bacteria. These bacteria can live in the human body without causing infection for years, and only surface when another illness has lowered the person's immunity to disease
symptoms: Characterized by high fever and severe internal bleeding
transmission: Can be spread from person to person

name: African Trypanosomiasis (“sleeping sickness”)
description: A severe and often fatal disease in humans and nonhumans primates (monkeys and chimpanzees) caused by the Ebola virus
symptoms: Characterized by high fever and severe internal bleeding
transmission: Can be spread from person to person

name: Hepatitis A
description: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver disease caused by the hepatitis A virus
symptoms: Symptoms include fever, fatigue, jaundice, and dark urine.
transmission: Spread primarily by the fecal-oral route or by ingestion of contaminated water or food

name: Hepatitis B
description: Approximately 2 billion people are infected with the hepatitis B virus (HBV), making it the most common infectious disease in the world today
symptoms: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver that causes symptoms such as jaundice, extreme fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain; hepatitis B is the most serious form of the disease. Chronic infections can cause cirrhosis of the liver or liver cancer in later years
transmission: Spread primarily by the fecal-oral route or by ingestion of contaminated water or food

name: HIV,Humman Immunodeficiency virus
description: HIV is the virus that causes Accquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS),a desease that attack the immune systhem, causing it's faillure and allowing opportunistic infections
symptoms: Characterized by high fever and severe internal bleeding
transmission: Heterosexual is the most case of transmission but other ways of infection include: needles, syringe, unsterilized invassive instruments and baies born to an infected mother

name: Pneumonia, Pneumonitis, Bronchopneumonia
description: Pneumonia is a lung infection affecting primarrly the microsopic air sacsknown as alveoli cause by virus or bacterial infection.
symptoms: the typical signs are cough, difficulty breathing, rapid heartbeat, fever, feeling generally unwell, sweating and shivering,loss of appetite, chess pain, headaches,nausea, fatigue, wheezing, joint and muscle pain
transmission: usually transmited by infection of virus or bacteria and commonly by other microorganisms,certain medications such as autoimmune deseases.

name: Syphilis, great imitator
description: Is a chronical bacterial desease
symptoms: The signs and sympthoms vary depending in which of the foue stages(primary,secondary,latent and tertiary), single chancre,skin ulceration,sores in the mouth or vagina, gumma,neurological or heart symptom
transmission: sexually transmitted infection cause by bacterium treponema pallidum but also congenitally by infection of a developing fetus

name: Tetanus, Lockjaw
description: Serious diseade that affects your nervous system leading to painful muscle contraction particularly of your jaw and neck
symptoms: The signs are fever, sweating, headache, trouble swallowing, high blood pressure and fast heart rate
transmission: transmitted by infecting individual when there is a breach in the first layer of barrier against diseases
skin or mucuous membranes
a breach caused by small cut or wound can also get contaminated by clostridium tetani

name: Whooping cough, Pertussis
description: Highly contagious respiratory infection caused by the bacterium bordetella pertussis
symptoms: Severe cough, characteristic sound on inhalation, vomiting at the end of a bout of coughing, apnoea, poor appetite, fatigue, dehydration
transmission: done by a bacterial called bordetella pertussis which isspreadby airborne droplets from the upper respiratory tract when the infected person cough or sneezes

name: Measles, Rubeola
description: Highly contagious infection caused by measles virus
symptoms: fever, cough, runny nose, inflamed eyes, diarrhea, blindness, inflammation of the brain
transmission: spread easily through the coughs and sneezes of those infected also spread through contact with saliva or nasal secretions

name: meningitis
description: Inflamation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord known as the meninges
symptoms: Fever, headache, neck stiffness, confusion, consciousness, vomiting
transmission: spread from person to person by exchanging of respiratory and throat secretions during close contact

name: Poliomyelitis
Polio,infantile,paralysis
description: infectious  viral disease caused by polio virus which mainly affects young children
symptoms: Fever
fatigue, headache, vomiting, stiffness in the neck, pain in the limbs
transmission: the virus is transmitted from person to person spread mainlt through the faecal-oralroute or by using contaminated water or food then multiplies in the intestine from where it can invade the nervous system and can cause paralysis.
